snippet: Despite rising delinquencies and repossessions, Santander Consumer USA had little trouble finding buyers for a $712 million bond deal containing many automobile loans to those with tarnished credit.
abstract: Ease with which Santander Consumer USA found buyers for $712 million bond deal consisting of auto loans to borrowers with bad credit shows that investors' appetite for subprime auto loans remains strong; investors have yet to be turned off by rising number of delinquencies and concerns raised by regulators about lending practices of subprime auto industry.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: Despite rising delinquencies and repossessions, Santander Consumer USA had little trouble finding buyers for a $712 million bond deal containing many automobile loans to those with tarnished credit.

headline.main: Many Buyers for Subprime Auto Loan Bundle
headline.print_headline: Many Buyers for Subprime Loan Bundle
